arm_group.description: Standard medical care and high sensitivity urine pregnancy test
Standard medical care and semi-quantitative panel test

brief_summary.textblock:
This randomized study will examine the effectiveness of two types of pregnancy tests (a
      semi-quantitative test and a high sensitivity test) to identify continuing pregnancy at home
      at various time points after early medical abortion. The first test a semi-quantitative
      panel test marketed under the brand name dBest (AmeriTek, Seattle WA, USA). This
      urine-based, one-step kit has been used in two previous studies in Vietnam (12, 13).  The
      second test is a locally available urine dipstick (Quickstick one-step hCG Pregnancy Test,
      Phamatech, San Diego, CA, USA).

        1. The investigators hypothesize that 99% of the SQPT and 35% of the HSPT will correctly
           identify ongoing pregnancy at day 14.

        2. The investigators hypothesize that 99% of the SQPT and 25% of the HSPT will correctly
           identify ongoing pregnancy at day 7.

        3. The investigators hypothesize that 75% of the SQPT and 10% of the HSPT will correctly
           identify ongoing pregnancy at day 4.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Pregnancy Tests as an Assessment Tool to Identify Continuing Pregnancy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Gestational age ≤63days from LMP

          -  Eligible for mifepristone- misoprostol medical abortion according to clinic
             guidelines(national guidelines stipulate that women can receive medical abortion thru
             63 days LMP at Hung Vuong (tertiary level) hospital; women with gestations up to 49
             days LMP can receive medical abortion at Hocmon (district) hospital)

          -  Willing to follow instructions of the provider regarding use of the pregnancy tests

          -  Able to read and write to use pregnancy test at home

          -  Willing to be randomized to perform one of two types of urine pregnancy tests at
             three time points at home

          -  Willing to provide an address and/or telephone number for purposes of follow-up

          -  Agrees to return for follow-up visit at clinic to confirm abortion status

          -  Wishes to participate in the study

          -  Able to consent to study participation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Women not meeting the above inclusion criteria

intervention.other_name: Quickstick one-step hCG Pregnancy Test, Phamatech, San Diego, CA, USA

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Effectiveness of Pregnancy Tests as an Assessment Tool to Identify Continuing Pregnancy After Early Medical Abortion

overall_official.last_name: Nguyen Thi Nhu Ngoc, MD, MsC

authority: Vietnam: Ho Chi Minh City Health Service

primary_outcome.description: Accuracy of these two types of home pregnancy tests to identify continuing pregnancy at four, seven and fourteen days after mifepristone administration.
primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of these two types of home pregnancy tests

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the two types of pregnancy tests at identifying continuing pregnancy

secondary_outcome.description: The use and acceptability of the two tests for women as a diagnostic tool to assess pregnancy status at home following early medical abortion
secondary_outcome.measure: The use and acceptability of the two tests
Correlation between the pregnancy test results determined by the woman at home and the abortion outcome determined by provider

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
